data.title: The climate of Russia and the best time to visit
data.meta_description: Discover the climate of Russia. Read about average temperatures, rainfall, and the ideal months to visit.
data.text:
What’s the climate like in Russia?

The current climate in Russia features temperatures ranging from a high of 24°C to a low of -9°C throughout the year. The average yearly temperature is around 9°C. At night, temperatures in the colder months average around -16°C and in the warmer months around 14°C.

The highest temperature recorded in Russia in recent years was 34°C in June 2021. The lowest daytime temperature recorded was -47°C in December 2020.

On average, Russia gets 563 mm of precipitation each year, including rain, snow, and hail. Of this, about 159 cm is snowfall. For comparison, United Kingdom gets 862 mm of precipitation each year.

Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec Temp. max (°C) -5 -3 1 11 18 22 24 24 16 8 -9 -3 Rainfall Rainfall (mm) 45 32 36 42 59 61 63 47 48 49 29 52 Snow (cm) 42 43 24 3,1 0,5 0 0 0 0 3,7 8,8 33

Click on the month name to see more weather details, like daily averages, temperatures, and precipitation for the past years in that month.

The best time to visit Russia for sunny weather is May through August. During this period, you'll have good temperatures and not too much rain, making it a great time to visit Russia. In the other months of the year, there's too much rain or the temperature isn't ideal for a visit if you want sunny and pleasant weather.

Check out the weather for Russia

Climate Table of Russia

The climate table of Russia shows the average temperatures, rainfall, snow, and UV index per month. The table gives an overview of the average day and night temperatures in degrees Celsius, the total amount of rainfall in millimetres, the total snowfall in centimetres, and the UV index for each month. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it's snow or hail.

Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec Temp. max (°C) -5 -3 1 11 18 22 24 24 16 8 -9 -3 Temp. min (°C) -10 -8 -7 2 8 12 15 14 8 2 -15 -8 Rainfall Rainfall (mm) 45 32 36 42 59 61 63 47 48 49 29 52 Snow (cm) 42 43 24 3,1 0,5 0 0 0 0 3,7 8,8 33 UV Index 1 2 4 4 6 5 5 5 3 2 1 1

Click on the month name to see more weather details, like daily averages, temperatures, and precipitation for the past years in that month.

Average yearly temperature: 9°C

Highest temperature: 24°C in July and August

Lowest temperature: -9°C in November

Precipitation*: 563 mm per year, averaging 47 mm per month

Snowfall: 159 cm per year

Driest months: 29 mm in November, 32 mm in February and 36 mm in March

Wettest months: 63 mm in July, 61 mm in June and 59 mm in May

*Precipitation is measured as a combination of rain, snow, and hail

Average Temperature per Month in Russia

This graph shows the average maximum temperatures per month in Russia. The temperatures are shown in degrees Celsius and the average is calculated based on the recorded temperatures per month from past years.

Average Rainfall per Month in Russia

This graph shows how much rainfall Russia gets on average per month. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it's snow or hail. This makes it easy to compare how much has fallen, regardless of the form of precipitation. The amount of rainfall is measured in millimetres and the average is calculated based on the recorded rainfall per month from past years.

Average Snowfall per Month in Russia

This graph shows how much snow Russia gets on average per month. The amount of snowfall is measured in centimetres and the average is calculated based on the recorded snowfall per month from past years.

Average UV Index per Month in Russia

This graph shows the average UV index per month in Russia. The UV index indicates the intensity of ultraviolet radiation and ranges from 0 to a maximum of 11.

Yearly Temperature in Russia

This graph shows the average yearly temperature in Russia. The yearly temperature, expressed in degrees Celsius, is the average of all twelve monthly temperatures summed up for that year.

Total Yearly Rainfall in Russia

This chart shows the total yearly rainfall in Russia over the past few years. The total yearly rainfall, measured in centimetres, is the sum of all the rain that fell in the twelve months of that year.

Total Yearly Snowfall in Russia

This chart shows the total yearly snowfall in Russia over the past few years. The total yearly snowfall, measured in centimetres, is the sum of all the snow that fell in the twelve months of that year.
